issues.description: In the template repository, Stock.addToStockIngredients invokes ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray, but the ArrayHelpers class only provides a method named appendElement. This method-name mismatch will cause compilation errors and prevent students from correctly modifying arrays of stock ingredients.
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename ArrayHelpers.appendElement to ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray (and update references accordingly) or change Stock.addToStockIngredients to call ArrayHelpers.appendElement instead of addElementToArray.

issues.description: The helper method for appending an element to an array is named `appendElement` in the template repository’s ArrayHelpers, but is renamed to `addElementToArray` in the solution repository’s ArrayHelpers. This mismatch in naming for the same conceptual operation can confuse students trying to map the template helper to the reference implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single consistent name for the array-append helper across both template and solution. For example, rename `appendElement` in the template to `addElementToArray`, or vice versa, so both artifacts refer to the same method name.
